name: cioppino
content:

an Italian American dish made from fish, seafood (= sea creatures with shells), and tomatoes cooked together in a small amount of wine: Mussels are great in seafood soups or stews, like cioppino or bouillabaisse. My fiancé had the Cioppino and was very happy with his meal.
More examplesFewer examplesOnce the cioppino is done, it needs to be served quickly, so the shellfish doesn’t overcook!Recipes for Cioppino stew vary widely depending on the restaurant or chef preparing it, as well as the seafood available.This lighter version of the traditional Cioppino is more than a soup, but less than a stew.American cioppino reflects immigration patterns, ethnic heritage, and local adaptation.
